in the round or size needed to obtain gauge scrap yarn for provisional co difficulty advanced beginner spare needle for working in the round lila cowl the lila cowl is a worked in the round in a chevron pattern it is the perfect size cowl to keep you warm and toasty while adding a pop of color to highlight your face pattern notes there are 2 versions for this cowl 1 the lila cowl by lux adorna on this page is written for an advanced beginner skill level the increase sts are worked using yo s 2 the lila cowl by pepperberry knits on the other page is an intermediate pattern the increase are worked using left and right lifted increase both make a beautiful chevron cowl the difference is skill and look the left and right lifted increase create increases that lean in the proper direction for a more polished look the yo increase is an easier skill yet also creates a lovely chevron pick whichever one you are comfortable with the lila cowl is worked in the round choose whichever method of knitting in the round that is comfortable to you use scrap yarn for the provisional co there is no need to weave in ends when you change colors for the stripes to change colors cut the working yarn leaving a 2 tail using a square knot tie the new yarn color to the tail snugly behind your last worked st you will work every color twice check your gauge you run the risk of not having enough yarn to do the second set of stripes if your gauge is off stitches s2kp - slip 2 stitches knitwise at the same time k1 pass the 2 slipped sts over yo - yarn over tbl - through the back loop pattern
